titlestmt.titleproper: Tēlemachos Alaveras Papers and Nea Poreia Archives, 1989-2010: Finding Aid C1408
titlestmt.author: Kalliopi Balatsouka

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 10:08:25 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Tēlemachos Alaveras Papers and Nea Poreia Archives
did.abstract: Consists of personal papers of Tēlemachos Alaveras, a prolific Modern Greek writer and editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia for more than fifty years. He was also the president of the Literary Society of Thessalonikē and member of boards of many other organizations. Included also are the archives of Nea Poreia, as well as the personal papers of Alaveras's father, Chrēstos Alaveras.
did.physloc: This collection is stored partially onsite (Boxes 14, 40, 46-47, 82, 85) at Firestone Library and partially offsite (rest of the boxes) at the ReCAP facility.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises ninety-seven boxes of autograph manuscripts and typescripts, correspondence, printed material, audio-visual material, and photographs pertaining to Tēlemachos Alaveras as a Greek writer and as an editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia. The papers include personal correspondence with major Greek writers and poets, such as Rita Boumē Papa, Dinos Christianopoulos, Margarita Dalmatē, Nikos Dēmou, Giōrgos Iōannou, Timos Malanos, Michalēs Meraklēs, Takēs Papatsōnēs, Pantelēs Prevelakēs, Apostolos Sachinēs, Helenē Vakalo, Giōrgos Veēs, and Chrysanthē Zitsaia. Included also are Alaveras's first writings, notebooks, talks, book reviews, interviews, and awards; writings by other people; the archives of the magazine Nea Poreia; material of other Greek associations or organizations where Alaveras was a board member or president; and finally, personal papers of Chrēstos Alaveras, Tēlemachos Alaveras's father.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Inquiries regarding publishing material from the collection should be directed to RBSC Public Services staff through the Ask Us! form. The library has no information on the status of literary rights in the collection and researchers are responsible for determining any questions of copyright.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tēlemachos Alaveras was born on September 30, 1926 in Plovdiv, Eastern Rumelia (now Bulgaria). The following year his family moved to Thessalonikē, a city they were destined never to leave. The writer appears in the literature with stories in magazines, and soon he asserts himself and becomes famous all over Greece. In 1952 he issued his first book, a series of stories drawn from the civil war in Greece, with the title Ta agrimia tou allou dasous. But the writer first appeared with the novel To horologi, second edition 1990, in the Greek literature. After that Alaveras published the books To miso tou phengariou (stories, 1960), second edition 1990; To sēmerino syngraphiko provlēma (essay, 1961); Hodostrōtēras, (novel, 1963), second edition 1973, third edition 1988. After a great break, Alaveras publishes the study Diēgēmatographoi tēs Thessalonikēs in 1970, and in 1971 the forerunning play in one act Hoi alloi. Apart from these his main study "Ta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs (1880-1955)" ["The literary magazines of Thessalonikē (1880-1995)"] was published in stories to be continued in the early press. In 1976 Alaveras issued seven stories with the title Ap'aphormē (second edition 1978). In 1977 this book received the First State Prize for story-writings. In 1985 he issued the volume of stories with the title Gōnies kai opseis, second edition 1988, which received the Ouranē Prize by the Academy of Athens. In 1987 he published the prose "Archeion" Averkiou Sverkiadē," and in 1990 the book Se eutheia grammē. Taxidi stēn Polōnia. In 1991 this book received the National Chronicle-Witness Award. In 1990 he issued one volume with critical notes in books with the title Sēmeiōseis.

Alaveras was the editor of the literary magazine Nea Poreia from the day the magazine was issued (1955). He was also the president of the Literary Society of Thessalonikē. He was a member of boards of state organizations and literary competitions, theater, and film-competitions.

His works have been translated into German, Dutch, Italian, Bulgarian, Swedish, Serbian, and Polish. Tēlemachos Alaveras belongs to the post-war novelists of Thessalonikē and is one of the first writers who exploited the theme of the Greek Civil War period. Married to poet Roula Alavera and had two sons. He died on June 30, 2007.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of Tēlemachos Alaveras's autograph and typed manuscript drafts of his writings; correspondence with his friends, colleagues, and acquaintants; documents; writings by others; personal photographs or in connection with Nea Poreia ; audio-visual material; and clippings of newspapers and literary magazines.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been organized into ten subseries: A. Correspondence; B. Works by Alaveras; C. Talks, Questionnaires, TV Series, and Interviews; D. Conferences and Meetings; European Programs; E. Literary Competitions and Awards; F. Documents; G. Writings by Others; H. Photographs; I. Audio-Visual Material; Designs; and K. Printed Material.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of incoming and outgoing correspondence with Tēlemachos Alaveras's close friends, colleagues, acquaintances, institutions, organizations, and foundations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been arranged in a chronological order by last name of individual or institution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consits of autograph and typed manuscripts of Alaveras's earliest and latest writings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been organized into books, diaries, and miscellaneous writings: the books have been arranged in an alphabetical order by the title of the work; the diaries and the miscellaneous writings have been arranged in a chronological order, starting with the earliest dates.

Papanoutsos; Tasos Korphēs; Helenē Vakalo; Nikos Karydēs; Apostolos Sachinēs; I.M. Panagiōtopoulos; Kōstas Stergiopoulos; Kritōn Athanasoulēs; Michaēl D. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Alaveras's autograph manuscripts of the diary he kept during his trip to Poland. There is also a separate folder with thank you and congratulation letters from the recipients of his book. Correspondents included are: Mētsakēs, Karolos; Pentzikēs, Nikos Gavriēl; Geralēs, Giōrgos; Athanasiadēs, Tasos; Kephalas, Ēlias; Makrēs, Solōn; Plōritēs, Marios; Glezos, Petros; Sarantē, Galateia; Plaskovitēs, Spyros; Kakridēs, Phanēs I.; Koutlēs, Thanasēs; Geranēs, Stelios; Vakalo, Helenē; Papakōnstantinou, Michalēs; Lampele Phoula; Mourelos, Giōrgos I.; Minōtēs, Alexēs; Zitsaia, Chrysanthē; Chatzēpateras, Kōstas N.; Markopoulos, [Giōrgos]; Vazra, Persa; Iōannidēs, I.D.; Anagnōstou, Tasos; Kaphtantzēs, Giōrgos, Skartsēs, Sōkratēs, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript drafts by Alaveras. Newspaper clippings from various local papers from 1965-1982 have been transfered in Box 43 (folder 1).

In this folder is kept material that Alaveras put together with the drafts of Sēmeiōseis, such as page proofs and clippings of articles or essays published in several Greek literary magazines. Included are: "Skepseis ap'aphormē tis prozes tou Themelē hopou synantietai hyliko tēs poiēsēs tou" published in Ho poiētēs Giōrgos Themelēs: tomos timētikos, 1971; "Prōtes synantēseis" published in Nea Hestia, 1698-1699 (1-15 April 1998); "Thelō mia eikona" dated July 1, 1993; "Me tous planētas" published in Nea Hestia, 1403 (1985); "Amerimnoamerimnos" published in Kritikē parousia tou Petrou S. Spandōnidē, (1992); "Entechnos logos" publisehd in hē lexē, 144 (March-April 1998); "Diavazontas ton Ḏostogiephski tou Tasou Athanasiadē"; "D.K. Vogazlēs: henas machētēs tou Valkanikou hellēnismou" published in Nea Hestia, 1571 (Christmas 1992); "Arthra kai meletēmata gia tē zōē kai to ergo tou Paulou Papasiōpē" in Elimeiaka, 3; Tou Giōtamē in Aphierōma ston I.M. Panagiōtopoulo, 1988; and "Logotechnika themata" in Nearchos, 29 (October-December 2003); "Katochiko" (23.2.1989).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

He also kept clippings of newspapers and other printed material that they were of his interest. The material is kept in the way Alaveras had organized it. A handwritten note on one of the discarded envelopes stated that all this material is unpublished.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes autograph manuscript drafts of Alaveras's essays, short stories, and poems in Greek. Some of them were kept in a folder entitled "Kampanes. Pezographēmata." Included are: "Hoi Megalexantroi" dated 1947 and published in the magazine Morphes, 9 (January 1947); "Polemikē pezographia" dated 1952; "Ho dromos mas. Se eikones pente pente skēnes" dated 1945; "Narkalieutēs"; "Phantastikes phōnes" dated 1949; "Henas logos me logikē kai chōris logikē" dated 1949; "T'agrimia tou allou dasous" dated 1950; "Hē pneumatikē Thessalonikē tou 1952"; a notebook with a novel entitled " Sta skotadia tēs Tsouka-Rōssa" dated 1952; "Pera apo to sēmeio stērigmatos" dated 1952. Other stories included are: "Moirolatrēs"; "To dentraki" dated 1944; "Ho mastro-Nikolas"; "Hagnē, Hagnoula"; "Gia to Mesolongi"; "To tēlephōno" dated 1944; "Hē emporissa"; and many others. There is also a small notebook dated 1962 and one folder consisting of undated early writings. Additionally, there are issues of the student magazine Pnoē/ 2-3, 6-7, where Alaveras published some of his earliest writings dated 1944-1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of autograph manuscripts and typescripts of short stories, poems, essays, translations, and book reviews. Included are writings by Thales Rētoridēs: "Triantaphyllenia zōē"; Mēnas Dēmakes; Giōrgos Delios: "Skies"; several poems by Zōe Karellē; Arēs Diktaios; Dēmētrēs A. Dēmētriadēs; Tasos Korphēs; Vasileios Laourdas; Jean Paul Mestas; Bampēs Nintas; Anthou Pōgōnitē; Giannēs Varverēs; Manos Eleutheriou; O. Sans; Tasia Adam; Nikos Papanas; Stauros Vavourēs; Takēs Varvitsiōtēs (the poem "Exoristos"); Andreas Angelakēs; a manuscript by an unknown author entitled "Delphikes giortes" with a handwritten copy of Angelos Sikelianos's letter dated March 12, 1925; and a book review by Panos K. Thasitēs (he signs as Vasiles Nēsiōtēs).

There is also an incomplete essay by Vasilēs Phrankos entitled: "Kritikē henos kritikou"; the poem "Symphōnia tou Septemvriou" by Milosz, O. V. de L. in Greek translation by Tasos Korphēs; the poem "Gynaika tēs Genova" by Dino Campana in Greek translation by Nikos Spanias; two translations by Takēs Varvitsiōtēs: "Ōdē sto Phenteriko Gkarthia Lorka" and "Ho cheimōnas mas"; book reviews written by G. Kyriakou; an interview of Cristino Sangiglio. Included are talks by Tadeusz Szymanski and Heinz Kunio that were given at the Jewish Community of Thessalonikē (1988).

Included also are: poetry contest of college students; a college paper on Chalastra of Thessalonikē; two papers of high school students; typescripts of poems of Greek college students that participated in a poetry contest. A typescript of a talk by Kounio, Chaints Salvatōr, "Apo ton Antisēmitismo tou Tritou Raich stē Nychta tōn Krystallōn kai ten telikē lysē tou Hevraikou provlēmatos."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes photographs of Tēlemachos and Roula Alaveras; portraits of Alaveras; Alaveras with his friends, colleagues, politicians, relatives, and acquaintances participating in several events: award ceremonies; meetings with old classmates; taks; literary symposia; book signings; book presentations; exhibitions; events organized by Roula Alavera; the opening ceremony of the Vaphopouleion Cultural Center; and others. There are also portraits of several Greek writers or poets, such as Giannēs Ritsos (included a copy of a photograph of Ritsos with Manos Katrakes in the exile); Dēmētrēs Dēmou; Kōstas Varnalēs; Giōrgēs Kotsiras; Paulos Papasiōpēs; Helenē Vakalo; Alkiviadēs Giannopoulos; Chrēstos Dalias; Anastasēs Vistōnitēs; Michales Meraklēs; Mēnas Dēmakēs; Paulos Spandōnidēs; Giannēs Sphakianakēs; Giōrgos Themelēs; and many others, as well as politicians.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries has been arranged in a chronological order except the first folder.

scopecontent.p: Includes offprints and issues of literary magazines. Included are: the article "Ta prōta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs (1921-1924)" by Dinos Christianopoulos published in Diagōnios, 1975; the essay "Hellēnikos logotechnikos periodikos typos (1974-1984)" by Antōnēs Kalphas dated 1985; Diavazō, 747 (1986); Aristotelēs 10 (May 15, 1889); Logotechniko deltio, 37 (August 1970); Exōstēs, 76 (December 22, 1989); Pyrsos tōn apophoitōn tou Peiramatikou, 3 (December 1953); Neanikē skepsē, 1 (December 1, 1929); Augē, 3 (1922); and clippings of Greek newspapers with reviews of Alaveras's book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes originals and photocopies, as well as clippings of several literary magazines, which according to Roula Alavera's note on the discarded envelope they were used as references for Tēlemachos Alaveras's study on the literary journals of Thessalonikē (see: "Ta logotechnika periodika tēs Thessalonikēs"). Included are: Aristotelēs, 1 (January 1889); Phōnē tēs proodou, 90 (October 1979); Makedonikē zōē, 172 (September 1980); Vivliothēkē, 118 (September 1, 2000) and 240 (January 24, 2003); 6ē Hēmera, 49 (February 12-13, 2000); Mēnes, (January-February and March-April 1962); Ta phoitētika grammata, 1 (March 1955); 2 (April 1955); and 3 (May-June 1953); Eumenēs, March and April 1959; and Kouinta, 6 (May 1996).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of autograph manuscripts and typescripts of published and unpublished works by several Greek writers or poets, including Tēlemachos Alaveras.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has been organized into five subseries: A. Nea Poreia Journal; B. Nea Poreia Publications; C. Associations-Organizations; D. Miscellaneous Documents: Legal; Financial; Contact Information; Press; Memorabilia; and E. Printed Material.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes originals and copies of autograph manuscripts and typescripts, as well as page proofs with autograph manuscript annotations of works by several modern Greek poets and writers published in the issues of the literary magazine Nea Poreia. There are also a few photographs (color and black-and-white); floppy disks; and clippings of Greek newspapers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: They have been arranged in a chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of autograph and typed manuscripts of poems, short novels, essays, or translations in Greek that were submitted for publication to Nea Poreia by several Greek authors. Included are published and unpublished writings. There are also several works, which are uncertain whether or not they have been published in Nea Poreia.

arrangement.p: This subseries has been arranged roughly chronologically.
